quest.name: A Boy's Errand
journal: Little does Nidhana know that she is about to send you on another errand.
objectives: Gather information at the tower outpost.
Ride the hamsa to the Giantsgall Grounds.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: If you will excuse me, I shall return to my work on the talisman.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Ah, you are both back. Excellent.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I have a message for you, Mistress Nidhana.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: It would seem the stores of giantsgall are running low.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: What? But when last I looked, there was still plenty...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I suspect that was before Urianger told everyone about their tempering cure, and Estinien shared his knowledge of dragons. Your peers have since been inspired to fashion a number of new talisman prototypes.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: I see... Well, if it leads to new possibilities, then far be it from me to complain, but we will need to replenish our stores...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I should be happy to tend to this if you like.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: As much as I appreciate the offer, my dear boy, I can't in good conscience send you out there alone while kidnappers are at large.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Forename─loath though I am to press another task on you so soon, might I ask you to fetch the giantsgall?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: In case you're not familiar, giantsgall is a type of ore found on the island. Owing to its hardness and aetherial conductivity, it has applications in many disciplines─alchemy not least of all.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: The quarry where it is found, aptly named Giantsgall Grounds, isn't far away, so it shouldn't take much of your time. May we impose on you once more?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Thank you! Upon arriving at the grounds, please seek out a man named Zeynuha. He will furnish you with the ore.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: At the very least, permit me to accompany you. It so happens I have an errand of my own that will take me to the outpost nearby.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: May we borrow a pair of hamsa, Mistress Nidhana?

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: By all means. Do try to be patient with them─those that survived are still in training.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I will bring the hamsa to the entrance. Meet me there when you are ready.

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Despite his tender years, Varshahn is thoughtful and dependable. It's easy to see why he was chosen to be the satrap's attendant!

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Here are our hamsa, Forename. If the creatures look familiar, it is because they are close kin to your Eorzean dodos.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Hamsa have long been kept as livestock in Thavnair, and many a hatchery may be found here. Alas, the largest of these was recently razed by monsters from the tower.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: On account of said hatchery being situated near the tower, the Radiant Host repurposed its remnants as an outpost.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: That is where my errand takes me, and your own destination is but a stone's throw away.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: If you have no objections, let us first make for the outpost. We set forth at your word.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: You are ready? Then let us depart. You need only ride and relax─my bird and I will take the lead for yours to follow.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Mount the hamsa and travel to the outpost?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Let us be off. If you haven't ridden dodos before, be warned that they have a wobbling gait.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: That spectacular formation stretching out over the water is called Khadga─a word which means “sword.”

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: This sword, legend holds, was wielded by the Manusya against the Mrga before it was cast down at conflict's end.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: To the left and requiring no introduction is the tower. As you can see, it straddles a small isle.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Almost there. Though the main part of the hatchery is atop the cliff, the outpost itself is on the beach.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: And here we are. Manned by the Radiant Host, this outpost is our first line of defense against the tower.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: Well, well, who should it be but young Varshahn. On an errand for the satrap?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I am. His Excellency bade me come to collect your report.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: He also wished to express his heartfelt gratitude to the brave men and women of the Radiant Host for their unflagging dedication.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: We simply do our duty, but we are honored to receive His Excellency's regard.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: And yet, for his boundless benevolence, his treatment of one so young could be regarded as...callous.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: Though we have enjoyed relative peace and calm these past few days, this remains the front line of battle. No place for children.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: Your predecessor too often traveled alone. It's been, what, two years now since you took over? I wonder how the fellow is faring...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Like those before him, he went on to represent the satrap in foreign lands. Wherever he may now be, I am certain he is well.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: As for myself, I assure you that all I do, I do of my own volition, and gladly. I pray you do not think ill of His Excellency.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: Certainly not, lad... Whatever happens, my faith in the satrap is unwavering. But still I worry for you.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: We would be overcome with sadness if something were to befall you, for you are as a little brother to us all. Take care, do you hear?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I will, Nahbdeen. Thank you.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: And who might this be? Not Hannish by the look of herhim.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Permit me to introduce Forename Surname, of the Eorzean contingent, come to assist in the making of the talisman.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: From Eorzea, you say! Towers have appeared over there too, yes? Tell me, what is the situation like?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: May I suggest that you exchange information with our soldiers? Both parties would stand to learn something of value, I believe.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: An excellent idea. Given the unprecedented nature of the threat, some of ours are understandably anxious. We would be glad for any tidings you can share.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: You two, bring Varshahn the latest report, and answer any questions he may have.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: All appears quiet with the tower at the moment. I daresay the soldiers won't mind if you approached them.

dialogue.name: BREEDINGSTAFF04374
dialogue.text: The last monster that came out of the tower laid waste to the hatchery, slaughtering many good hamsa. The poor creatures didn't deserve it...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This is the fellow that carried you hither. Its breathing is somewhat ragged, perhaps due to its inexperience as a mount.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: It occurs to me I have yet to properly introduce our company.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: We are the Radiant Host, a military order under the satrap's command. Our duty is to preserve peace in the land, be it patrolling the streets or dealing with heretofore unknown threats such as now.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: We train hard, and admit only capable warriors to our ranks. Even so, we've struggled to contend with the fiends from the tower.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: Though we succeeded in striking them down on the two occasions they came in force, we had to pay a heavy price.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: What of the towers in Eorzea? Do they likewise spawn monsters?

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: So it's much the same everywhere... With every nation struggling, we cannot expect calls for outside aid to be answered.

dialogue.name: NAHBDEEN
dialogue.text: My thanks not only for the information, but for accompanying Varshahn besides. While he's wise beyond his years, he's still a child, and we couldn't bear to see him come to harm.

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: You wish to know about the tower? To be honest, we know little and less about it ourselves.

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: This “Tower of Zot,” as folk have taken to calling it, suddenly appeared where it did on the isle of Narunnair.

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: We're safe from its influence at this distance, but go too far into the water, and you'll expose yourself to its corrupting aether.

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: You're a foreigner, aren't you? How are they dealing with the tower in your homeland?

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: Our struggles are not unique... Then our hopes still lie with the talismans. We must keep the monsters contained until they're ready.

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: When the tower first appeared, we sent scouts on a boat to investigate. But it quickly became apparent that something was amiss.

dialogue.name: KHUTEEYU
dialogue.text: One after another our comrades were corrupted. We could only look on in horror as they slew each other...

dialogue.name: IMHUDI
dialogue.text: Ah, I've heard about you. The visitor from Eorzea. Is there anything you can tell us about the Telophoroi?

dialogue.name: IMHUDI
dialogue.text: We know that they're the ones behind the tower, and that they've declared war on the whole world.

dialogue.name: IMHUDI
dialogue.text: But why are they doing this? What is it that they want? This, we don't understand.

dialogue.name: IMHUDI
dialogue.text: ...What? They want to die...and take everyone with them!? What madness is this!?

dialogue.name: IMHUDI
dialogue.text: Well, you can bet that we won't let those bastards have their way! We'll fight them with everything we have, like our Eorzean and Far Eastern brothers!

dialogue.name: IMHUDI
dialogue.text: Grrr, those demented fools... If they want to go to hell, they can bloody well arrange their own passage, and leave the rest of us out of it!

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Finished speaking with the soldiers, have you? I hope it was as enlightening for you as it was for them.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: As a neutral nation and trading hub both, Radz–at–Han ordinarily receives a steady stream of news from abroad. Alas, this stream dried up when trading vessels stopped coming.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Amidst the dearth of information, everyone will have been grateful for your account.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: ...But come, you had best see to your original errand. As mine will keep me here awhile longer, however, I'm afraid I cannot guide you the rest of the way.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Worry not, the path is straightforward─you need but follow the road east. Upon the hamsa, you will arrive before you know it.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Brief though it was, I enjoyed our time together. Till we meet again.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Lest you have forgotten, to get to the Giantsgall Grounds, you need but follow the road east. The hamsa should deliver you there quite quickly.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Though the hamsa appears to want to return home, it reluctantly offers you its back.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you become separated from your steed, speak with the Radiant beastkeeper at the Hamsa Hatchery to mount it again.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Mount the hamsa?

dialogue.name: BREEDINGSTAFF04374
dialogue.text: If you're looking for your hamsa, it returned here by itself a while ago. You still have need of it?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: No sooner do you arrive at your destination than the hamsa dashes off...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with the Radiant beastkeeper at the Hamsa Hatchery to mount the hamsa, then ride it to the Giantsgall Grounds.

dialogue.name: ZEYNUHA
dialogue.text: Aye, this is indeed the Giantsgall Grounds, and I am Zeynuha. Is there something you require?

dialogue.name: ZEYNUHA
dialogue.text: Giantsgall for the alchemists, you say? But of course they shall have it!

dialogue.name: ZEYNUHA
dialogue.text: They labor tirelessly to deal with the tower, and 'tis the least we can do to provide them with the materials they need.
